newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-SCOTLAND COACH BROWN STANDS BY HIS MEN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SCOTLAND COACH BROWN STANDS BY HIS MEN.

text.p: Scotland manager Craig Brown named a virtually unchanged squad on Friday for his side's home World Cup qualifying matches against Estonia and Austria.
Rangers goalkeeper Andy Goram is sidelined through injury and Celtic defender Jackie McNamara is dropped despite starting Scotland's last two matches.
Otherwise Brown has remained loyal to the players he bitterly criticised after their 0-0 draw with Estonia in Monaco last month.
Scotland face Estonia in Kilmarnock on March 29, three days before they play Austria at Celtic Park.
Their last match against Estonia, played in Monaco, was a replay of their now infamous match in Tallinn last October which was abandoned after three seconds.
Estonia refused to take the field after the kick-off time was brought forward following Scottish complaints about floodlighting.
Scotland head European qualifying group four with eight points from four matches. Austria and Estonia have both played a game fewer and have seven and four points respectively.
Goalkeepers - Neil Sullivan (Wimbledon), Jim Leighton (Hibernian), Scott Howie (Motherwell)
Defenders - Colin Calderwood (Tottenham Hotspur), John Collins (Monaco), Colin Hendry (Blackburn), Brian McAllister (Wimbledon), Alan McLaren (Rangers), Tommy Boyd (Celtic), Tosh McKinlay (Celtic)

Midfielders - Craig Burley (Chelsea), Billy McKinlay (Blackburn), Scott Gemmill (Nottingham Forest), Gary McAllister (Coventry), Paul McStay (Celtic), Ian Ferguson (Rangers), Paul Lambert (Borussia Dortmund)
Forwards - Kevin Gallacher (Blackburn), Duncan Ferguson (Everton), John McGinlay (Bolton), John Spencer (Queens Park Rangers), Eoin Jess (Coventry), Ally McCoist (Rangers), Darren Jackson (Hibernian)
